note.p: Death: The Earl of Leicester's house, Great Russell Street, Bloomsbury Square (1744)

Career: Practised as an advocate in Naples; met a member of Sir Thomas Coke's (later the Earl of Leicester's) household by whom he was converted to Anglicanism; Librarian to the Earl of Leicester; died of the stone; left a valuable library to the Earl of Leicester
Notes: Proposed by James Jurin, on behalf of Richard Meade
